column5: I actually did get a pass today.  My wife is a good woman.
I LOVE the excuses for not posting pics!!!   ... somebody shoot me if I'm wrong!!!

lol...are you insinuating that fishermen might tend to bend the truth ...  my fishing camera is a sony and they have cards that are small like no other system..  .they come with thier own card adaptor so the card can be read in any generic card reader or laptop..  .(PITA) ....this little adapter was left in the wifes laptop when it went to school with the youngest kid and was to return home last night for thanksgiving weekend ....( he forgot it on his desk in north york but remebered to bring the laptop home)   He has been in school since late August but i only realized middle of Sept that the reader was in her laptop   ... the little adaptor thing is 120 bucks at our local wallymart and im not prepared to pay that price for a fishing camera that is on its way out of service..  .so my crosshairs are already set on a kid that is absent minded but im sure i can accomadate a double shooting if ya want ..

... yup! both of my camera's are Sony Cyber-Shots!!!... no excuse, 'puter and printer reads them all fine and well... with or without the adapter crap..... I guess a poor excuse is better than no excuse!  my guess is that maybe you should take pics anyway... that way you'll have something to share with the old ladies in the coffee clatch!!!

Do we have a mister perfect here or what, I got out with Splashhopper yesterday missed a lmbass caught a 12" smbass & one 23" pike gone fishing with my son & might post pictures when I get back Richard
Heres one that didn't get away ....   Yesterday morning 8:00 am on the '' Way '' up fishing...
Poor thing.

My puter is almost a year old (obsolete already?)...it has slots for every card in the world EXCEPT Sony...i thought i was stupid for buying a sony camera but i see you are twice as smert as me   I did take the pics and they are on my camera...so if it porn ya want ....might i suggest you cmon over and see them on my camera and meet  the coffee club ( bring some of the southern shine with ya cuz im sure they will need it to tolerate ya ) or even better ...i hear Marge Simpson is on the cover of Playboy ( she might fullfill your need for porn)  http://news.yahoo.com/s/nm/20091010/od_nm/us_simpson_4   i went down to the river today but with the storm that went through last night ...it is a sespool of mud....went up to another river (tea stained water) but the wind was too hard to get a drift..

Blown as in dirty, though it should be cleaning up nicely by today.  There's plenty of pike around the Hammer, though they've been shunning me this season.  Massacred the whistletrout this summer though All the piers & points back in the bay will hold fish at different parts of year, though it takes a bit of footwork to figure out which when.  Which I didn't yesterday, fished all day all around harbour without so much as a sniff from anything.  Water has turned over so there's not even whistletrout to fall back on.  Too early for the browns to be showing up, salmon haven't made it to Bayfront yet, and the pike have just up & disappeared.  Aaaargh, brought the net, camera and the proper card (lol), should've known I wouldn't catch squat!

Seriously Twocoda, you can buy one of the little usb cables that plugs into your camera and a USB port on your puter... it's all I use!  http://www.buynshop.com/productinfo/1454/DC-CBSY-B/  They sell them at Wal-Mart in the electronics dept... very cheap!
pike at my spot
Message sent....
Looks like I'm in Kincardine in the morning Salmon & Trout & Bass & Pike in the afternoon, Sweet Richard
STEELHEAD Sunday, Lake H tribs!!!  Bring on the chrome  Paul
" Im hittin the credit river for some salmon fishing saturday.

Muskies, Muskies and more Muskies here on the Ottawa R....well maybe the odd walleye too  ....my daughter's up from Georgia with the baby and son-in-law and wants to spend the day out on the boat Monday to get a nice skie!!....I'm heading out in a couple of minutes  Have a great Thanksgiving weekend everyone and play safe out there!!
You go catch us a big'un now, ya heah me boy?!!!  Have fun Steve!!!
Goin for Skies, buckets & brownies in Buckhorn!  Hopefully the weathers doesn't suck too bad.
Smallies and steelies if all goes per plan, two rivers, one empties at Erie the other at Huron.
Havent heard anything about Dalhousie yet. We were thinking of going up there tonight to check it out.
Fishing for walleyes at night, when sunrise happens muskies are the ticket it doesnt get much better than that

Niagara is sure to be blown, Dalhousie will probably be a zoo if there's any fish being caught.  There's pike & brown trout in Hamilton Harbour, and I will catch one of each this weekend.  Oh yes...I will.....
Blown? lol.  We might make the trip up that way.  I haven't seen pike there.  Which part of the harbour?  The pier? or like, back the other way past the lift bridge bridge in that bay.
who wants to let me board their boat on the Franny?lol
I'm heading down for Steel/Salmon at the rapids tonight.  Can't wait!
It should be interesting to see who takes their camera and does us a nice report!  We love the fish porn yanno!!!
Well Glen.... I did go out for a couple hours with my daughter..... not even a sniff    and I had my camera with me  Also broke my brand new medium heavy action rod   :wallbash:
What I caught today was not worth a camera shot    Although the few I lost probably were!!!!
How the Heck did that happen....     Besides when the winds from the North ..don't go Forth ......
Broke the end of it just before leaving   :wallbash:  now it's a foot short Will be heading to the store where I bought it tomorrow morning and see if I can get another

Dammit man!!! I hate when that happens!!  .. hate it worse tha a 'possum hates an axe handle!!!  Whenever I break a favorite rod, I have to disarm myself and throw my pocket knife into the water to keep from slitting my own throat!!!  The only thing you can do is write it of as a sacrifice to the fishing gods, and find solace in the fact that they may smile on you in the near future!    ... lemme guess!... the big one got away?!!!

Oooohhhh I was so mad G     them graphite rods are great and light but somehow so brittle The good thing is, I have my receipt and if they (the Store) don't give me another.... I'll just buy a brand new one
Biggest one of the day I'm sure...  1 second it's jumping and screaming line, the next it's in the wood

I fished an Orillia-area lake with a couple of buddies for several hours on Saturday.  We landed one small pike and this smallmouth bass which put on quite the top-water swimming display.  Caught it on a pumpkin senko rigged wacky style in 6 feet of water off the tip of an island.  It was a great day to be on the water with lots of colourful scenery and mostly sunny skies.
i went out for an hour ...brought the camera and caught one 10ish pound bow....no card reader for the camera to get the pics on to computer...
Where and for What?
Fishing for Salmon tomorrow night..  Going to try a bunch of places, Hamilton Harbour, Bronte Pier, Port Dalhousie.. The usuals
China, man eating catfish.
you too!?!?!  See ya there!
Sturgeon River ......... Walleye , Muskie , Pike...  How 'bout you?  RFS
Going to try to get out for some rainbows at my favourite spot  ....
I will be hittin the Thames... tryin and tie into one of these big musky.  Also might try and get me some walleye... hopefully the weather holds up !
going after some bass and walleye this weekend!
Likely walleyes
I wish.  Looks like I didn't get a pass for the weekend.
I think I'll be trying for anything that bytes in one of our local lakes If the weather cooperates Leechman
Bass & Pike for sure Maybe Salmon & Trout Grey Bruce area Spinnerbaitking's country hey Splashhopper Richard
Gonna hit up a few lakes in the Haliburton area.  Cant wait
Perch in LPB
how is the perch in long point bay right now? Im thinking of heading down if the weather holds up. whats the easiest way to find the perch?  Ive been down a few times but they can be anywhere
lookin to get some pike, walleye and bass this weekend. maybe an inland lake or the local st. mary's river down by st. joseph island/pine island.
salmon and bow fishing for me ...
the eye's have it, might go for a SKI too...
hope to get a few hours on the upper niagara on monday morning (shhhhh don't tell my wife...just got back from fishing today and don't won't to spring this on her just yet)

Bows and salmon for me, georgian bay was good last weekend,todays rain might just do it.going back up tonight. I wonder how port dalhousie and the niagara are doing, havent gone yet,any info would be great.
The next 3 weeks is perchin as much as I can. Love those tasty little buggers.

Hopefully help my great-grandson catch his first sunfish, perch, bluegill, wgsf or crappie off the visitor's dock down at our park...a bit late in the season and the weeds are mostly down but who knows???  Will get his dad to dig up a few worms out back so he gets the whole experience...
pigeon lake for muskies!

heading up hwy 129 towards chapleau, fishing a lake called burntwood about 50-60km north of aubery falls. i've been told the road to the lake is flooded, we'll have to see about that. first time going in there, my buddy is the guide cause hes been there before. going for walleye and pike. i sure hope i see a couple birds on the roads to!!
hitting up some gbay tribs sunday for the first time since spring. trying to hook into anything that will take my roe bag or flies? lol
